Class UGraph

java.lang.Object
edu.ufp.inf.Util.Graph
edu.ufp.inf.Graph.UGraph
All Implemented Interfaces:

public class UGraph extends Graph implements Serializable
Represents an undirected graph.

  • Method Details

    • hasEdge

      public boolean hasEdge(Integer id1, Integer id2)
      Checks if there is an edge between two vertices. Time Complexity: O(V), where V is the number of vertices in the graph. It iterates over the adjacent vertices of one vertex to check if there is an edge to another vertex. Extra Space: O(1). The additional space used is constant, as it only stores references to adjacent vertices temporarily.
      Parameters:
      id1 - The ID of the first vertex.
      id2 - The ID of the second vertex.
      Returns:
      True if there is an edge between the vertices, false otherwise.

    • dfs

      public void dfs(int v, boolean[] visited)
      Performs a depth-first search (DFS) on the graph. Time Complexity: O(V + E), where V is the number of vertices and E is the number of edges in the graph. It performs a depth-first search traversal of the graph. Extra Space: O(V). The additional space is used to store the visited array, which tracks visited vertices during the DFS traversal.
      Parameters:
      v - The vertex to start the search from.
      visited - An array to keep track of visited vertices.

    • isConnected

      public boolean isConnected()
      Checks if the graph is connected. Time Complexity: O(V + E), where V is the number of vertices and E is the number of edges in the graph. It calls the dfs method to perform a depth-first search traversal. Extra Space: O(V). Similar to dfs, it uses extra space for the visited array.
      Returns:
      True if the graph is connected, false otherwise.

    • isConexo

      public boolean isConexo()
      Checks if there is a connection between all vertex of the graph Time Complexity: O(V + E), where V is the number of vertices and E is the number of edges in the graph. It performs a depth-first search traversal. Extra Space: O(V). It uses extra space for the visited array.
      Returns:
      True if it has, false otherwise.

    • isConexov2

      public boolean isConexov2()
      Checks if there is a connection between all vertex of the graph Time Complexity: O(V + E), where V is the number of vertices and E is the number of edges in the graph. It performs a depth-first search traversal. Extra Space: O(V). It uses extra space for the visited array.
      Returns:
      True if it has, false otherwise.

    • minimumHopsBetween

      public Integer minimumHopsBetween(int orig, int dest)
      Finds the minimum number of hops (edges) between two vertices in the graph. Time Complexity: O(V + E), where V is the number of vertices and E is the number of edges in the graph. It performs a breadth-first search traversal to find the minimum number of hops between two vertices. Extra Space: O(V). It uses additional space for the boolean array marked[], the edgeTo[] array, and the distTo[] array.
      Parameters:
      orig - The ID of the origin vertex.
      dest - The ID of the destination vertex.
      Returns:
      The minimum number of hops between the vertices, or -1 if there is no path between them.

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
